sentences.cn: “ 我不大明白他的话, 先生. ” 摩根答道.

sentences.en: As you so rightly pointed out , things are getting worse.
sentences.cn: 你说得很对，情况越来越不妙了。

sentences.en: British voters are rightly suspicious of attempts to save money in the area of education.
sentences.cn: 英国选民怀疑当局企图削减教育经费是有根据的.

sentences.en: Education, quite rightly, is currently at the forefront of the political agenda.
sentences.cn: 目前教育被排在政治议程的首位，这样做非常恰当。

sentences.en: Everyone rightly feared the coming war.
sentences.cn: 人人都担心战争即将爆发,这是理所当然的.

sentences.en: He has rightly interrupted his holiday in Spain to return to London.
sentences.cn: 他马上中止了在西班牙的度假回到伦敦。

sentences.en: He rightly assumed that the boy was hiding.
sentences.cn: 他猜对了，那个男孩躲起来了。

sentences.en: He was rightly suspicious of meeting me until I reassured him I was not writing about him.
sentences.cn: 当然他很不放心见我，直到我再一次向他保证我不是在写他。

sentences.en: I don't rightly know whether it was Tuesday or Wednesday.
sentences.cn: 我说不准那天是星期二还是星期三.

sentences.en: I was, as you rightly said , the smallest boy in the class.
sentences.cn: 你说的没错，我是班级里最小的男孩。
他所知道的消息可信 吗 ?

sentences.en: Rightly constituted laws, said Aristotle, should be the final sovereign.
sentences.cn: 亚里士多德说, 正确制定的法律应该是最高的权威.

sentences.en: She had rightly guessed that Mr. Gryce's egoism was a thirsty soil.
sentences.cn: 她早已察觉培育着古莱先生自尊心的土壤是贪瘠的.

sentences.en: She rightly points to the inadequacy of the argument.
sentences.cn: 她准确地指出这个论点的不足之处.

sentences.en: The judge quite rightly says that he has to interpret the law as it's been passed.
sentences.cn: 法官说他必须按照该法的立法初衷来阐释它，这完全没错。

sentences.en: These prisoners were rightly punished for their crimes.
They have been treated badly, and they are rightly upset.
sentences.cn: 他们受到了不公正的对待，生气是理所当然的。

sentences.en: They were rightly praised for their thrift and enterprise.
sentences.cn: 他们勤俭节约，积极进取，得到了当之无愧的赞扬。

sentences.en: This photo was taken in Paris, if I remember rightly .
sentences.cn: 如果我没记错的话，这张照片是在巴黎拍的。

正确地；恰当地；公正地；合适地

phrases.tran_cn: [多用作插入语]且不管对还是错

trans.tran_en: correctly, or for a good reason
